pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2: “Tonics” renders _bhesajja_. In this rule the only _bhesajja_ mentioned are one or other of the five tonics. I consequently assume that this is main meaning in this rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7: One _doṇa_ measure of ghee. According “On the Ancient Coins and Measures of Ceylon”, by Thomas Rhys Davids, p.18, one _doṇa_ is equivalent to 64 handfuls. It may well be that this amounts to more than one liter, but given the uncertainty one liter seems like a suitably round number.
